Text: TRC Spill Cleanup GuidelinesGLO Oil Spill Penalties Cc Texas RailRoad Commission TRC has sent a guideline for cleanup of condensate spills to its District Offices for implementation on July Attached is the guideline which is titled Field Guide for the Assessment and Cleanup of Soil and Groundwater Contaminated with Condensate From a Spill Incident Statewide Rules and The introduction to the guideline states that it establishes bench marks and protocols that when met and followed will demonstrate that condensate spills have been addressed in a manner that complies with Statewide Rules and Some comments related to this guideline from an industry association meeting in midJuly are listed below There appeared to be a wide variation in response of the districts to this guideline The TRC is receiving landowner compliants The TRC has gone out and found spills not cleaned up where closure reports have been submitted Parts of the guideline are not clear and the groundwater classification is not consistent with TRRP A revised guideline might be issued by TRC This condensate guideline is temporary until RBCA guidelines are available TRC is working on a software model projected by the end of this year Also attached is another guideline that the TRC issued at the same time which is titled Field Guide for Reportable Surface Releases of Crude Oil in Nonsensitive Areas Statewide Rules and In a somewhat related item the General Land Office on June issued revised penalty guidelines attached effective August st for oil spills in Texas coastal waters Spills of less than a gallon will have fines of The fines for larger spills will depend on factors such as the size of the spills the number of unauthorized discharges in the past twelvemonth period and whether a Sound Management Practice or like program is in place

TRC Spill Cleanup Guidelines Cc Texas Railroad Commission has posted new versions of two spill cleanup guidelines Field Guide for the Assessment and Cleanup of Soil and Groundwater Contaminated with Condensate From a Spill Incident and Field Guide for Reportable Surface Releases of Crude Oil in NonSensitive Areas on its web site at divisionsognoticespubsswrnoticesogpnhtml Copies of the two quidelines in html formal are also attached to this notice The introductory page on the web site states To ensure consistent interpretation of Statewide Rules and as they pertain to crude oil and condensate spills the RRC has issued two field sampling guidance documentsBoth of the field guides describe reporting sampling and analysis requirements as well as provide the default cleanup concentrations In all cases an apppropriate risk assessment may be used in lieu of the defaullt cleanup concentrations The guidelines are effective November The condensate guideline is temporary until the RBCA guidelines become available The Texas Railroad Commission plans to issue the RBCA guidelines by the end of this year
